name: Topic Name
subject: Subject Name
description: Brief description of the topic for the overview panel.

subtopics.name: Subtopic Name
subtopics.what: Explanation of what this subtopic covers. This appears in the purple 'What is this section about' panel.
subtopics.why: Explanation of why this subtopic matters and how it connects to real-world applications or other learning.

items.title: I can [verb] [specific skill or concept]
items.what: Detailed explanation of what this learning outcome means. What does the student need to understand or be able to do?
items.why: Why this skill matters. How will it help them? What does it connect to?
items.example: A concrete example demonstrating this concept. Use specific numbers, scenarios, or worked examples.

_template_notes.id: Unique identifier for this topic, used for storing progress. Use kebab-case.
_template_notes.name: Display name shown in the topic selector dropdown.
_template_notes.subject: The subject area (Mathematics, Science, English, etc.)
_template_notes.yearLevel: Year level as displayed (Year 9, Year 10, etc.)
_template_notes.class: The class code that will auto-populate in settings (e.g., 9A Mathematics)
_template_notes.description: Brief overview shown in the topic header area
_template_notes.subtopics: Array of subtopic sections, each with items
_template_notes.subtopic.id: Unique identifier for this subtopic within the topic
_template_notes.subtopic.icon: Emoji icon displayed next to subtopic name
_template_notes.subtopic.what: Explanation for the 'What is this section' expandable panel
_template_notes.subtopic.why: Explanation for the 'Why does it matter' expandable panel
_template_notes.item.id: Unique numeric ID for this learning item (must be unique across all subtopics)
_template_notes.item.title: The 'I can...' statement - the learning intention
_template_notes.item.code: Reference code (e.g., 1.1, 1.2, 2.1) shown next to the item
_template_notes.item.what: Detailed explanation shown in 'What Why Example' panel
_template_notes.item.why: Why this matters - shown in 'What Why Example' panel
_template_notes.item.example: Concrete example - shown in 'What Why Example' panel
_template_notes._note: Remove this _template_notes section when creating actual topic files
